cast.overview: The life of an unsuccessful writer is transformed by a top-secret 'smart drug' that allows him to use 100% of his brain and become a perfect version of himself. His enhanced abilities soon attract shadowy forces that threaten his new life.
cast.title: Limitless

cast.overview: In 19th century New York high society, a young lawyer falls in love with a woman separated from her husband, while he is engaged to the woman's cousin.
cast.title: The Age of Innocence

cast.overview: Obsessive master thief Neil McCauley leads a top-notch crew on various daring heists throughout Los Angeles while determined detective Vincent Hanna pursues him without rest. Each man recognizes and respects the ability and the dedication of the other even though they are aware their cat-and-mouse game may end in violence.
cast.title: Heat

cast.overview: An aspiring dancer moves to New York City and becomes caught up in a whirlwind of flighty fair-weather friends, diminishing fortunes and career setbacks.
cast.title: Frances Ha

details.biography: Cindy Katz is an American actress known for her work in film, television, and theater. She trained at the Yale School of Drama and began her career with important stage roles before transitioning to screen appearances. Katz has appeared in notable films such as The Age of Innocence (1993), I Love Trouble (1994), and Heat (1995). Television credits include guest roles on Star Trek: Deep Space Nine, Frasier, Friends, Star Trek: Voyager, Fringe, Law & Order, and The Good Wife among others. She has been recognized for her versatility and depth as a performer, and on Broadway she earned an Outer Critics Circle Award nomination for her role as Constanze in Amadeus. Katz remains active in theater and screen acting, continuing to take on a variety of roles across genres and platforms.
details.name: Cindy Katz
